--- title: a lot of a little and a little of a lot --- ::: {.callout-note collapse="true"} ````{html}
*specialized generalist* - aka one who cannot make up his mind...
``` ::: {.justify} > These are the principles for the development of a complete mind: Study the science of art. Study the art of science. Learn to see. Realize that everything connects to everything else. ::: {.attribute} [Leonardo da Vinci](https://philosophynow.org/issues/134/The_Mind_of_Leonardo_da_Vinci)

::: ::: ::: {.justify} > I suppose it is tempting, if the only tool you have is a hammer, to treat everything as if it were a nail. ::: {.attribute} [Maslow's Hammer](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Maslow%27s_hammer#English) ::: :::

Without a broad foundation, it's facile to slide into [confirmation bias](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1037/1089-2680.2.2.175) by "seeking or interpreting of evidence in ways that are partial to existing beliefs".

:::
